intro: Lipocarpha mangarevica, commonly known as the mangareva bulrush, is a flowering plant native to the Society Islands in French Polynesia. It is a member of the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant is characterized by its dense, grass-like foliage and produces small, clustered flowers that are typically wind-pollinated. It thrives in brackish or saline wetlands, often found in coastal areas and estuaries. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
